the article from the federalist discusses surgeon general vivek murthy s 81  page advisory titled  our epidemic of loneliness and isolation   the author expresses concern over the report s plan to address social isolation as a public health crisis  which includes elements of surveillance  mandatory diversity  equity  inclusion  dei  policies  and federal control of local infrastructure and organizationsthe author argues that this strategy could lead to unprecedented government regulation of private lives and relationships  which they see as a threat to freedom  they emphasize the importance of the private sphere of life for the survival of freedom and argue that privacy is necessary for developing true friendships and having real conversationsthe author also criticizes the advisory s potential threat to the first amendment rights of free speech  religion  and association  which they believe are essential for developing strong relationships  they express skepticism towards the government s ability to  fix  social relationships  especially given the surgeon general s stance on free speechthe article also discusses the historical pattern of totalitarian regimes seeking to control all aspects of life  starting with education and media  and eventually targeting family  faith  and community  the author sees murthy s advisory as a potential blueprint for government absorption of the private sphere of life  which they believe would further erode and eventually dismantle freedom of speech  religion  and associationthe author concludes by arguing that society should coalesce around freedom  not safety  and warns against trading the private sphere of life for the illusion of safety offered by an authoritarian state  they believe that freedom  despite its risks and conflicts  offers a more fulfilling life than the pseudo  safety offered by tyrants

thanks for the link it helped me get to the source here   pitchfest 2024 seeks to create a community of poc bakers and entrepreneurs  gathered by their shared love for baking  the program is divided into two editions  one focusing on bakeries and the other on baking products  ensuring a broad scope of creative talent is recognized and nurtured  according to king arthurmolly lawrence  corporate social responsibility manager  king arthur baking  said the diversity of applicants and the potential for innovative products and business concepts furthers king arthur ’s mission to support increased racial and ethnic diversity in the field“pitchfest 2024 is a testament to our commitment to fostering a more inclusive baking community and empowering creative poc leaders in the industry  ” lawrence saidkathleen casanova  executive director  project potluck  said it ’s important to expand diverse voices in the baking industry“baking pitchfest 2024 is more than a competition  it ’s a platform for empowering people of color to break barriers and redefine the narrative in baking  ” casanova saidthe application process for baking pitchfest runs from jan  2 through feb  10  to be eligible  individuals and businesses must be poc  led and members of project potluck  with a straightforward membership process for interested poc individuals  while the product edition is open nationwide  the bakery edition targets businesses in washington state and the northeastern states of connecticut  maine  massachusetts  new hampshire  new york  rhode island and vermontproject potluck  founded in 2020  seeks to address the challenges faced by poc in the food and beverage industries  by focusing on issues like inherent bias in hiring  networking gaps and lack of access to capital for poc entrepreneurs
